intro: Monochaetum longicaudatum, commonly known as the long-tailed spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to Australia, particularly found in the tropical and subtropical regions of the northeastern part of the country. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikes, typical of the Cyperaceae family. Monochaetum longicaudatum is often found in wetlands, swampy areas, and along the edges of water bodies.
